attributes.action: Build a statue outside of the Meir Primary Care Centre.
attributes.additional_details: The pub was built in 1935 and was knocked down in 2008. However similar pubs stood there previously, miners and other workers often went there after work to socialise and have a chat.
attributes.background: Before this health care centre was constructed, there stood a magnificent pub called the King's Arms. It had so much history with it, including pilots during the Second World War going to there. It was so important to so many people and the least that we can do is build a statue in its honour.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. You could make this suggestion to your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.stoke.gov.uk/councillors/name

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here:

https://www.stoke.gov.uk/info/20043/councillors_and_decision-making/137/petitions

You'll need to give your full name to start a petition.
